items.sentence: I\'ll call you up around eight this evening.
I\'ll come visit you at your house tomorrow.
I couldn\'t believe that that was happening.
I couldn\'t get my idea across to the class.
I couldn\'t go with you even if I wanted to.
Tom certainly isn\'t very good with numbers.
Tom certainly wasn\'t very happy about that.
Don\'t worry. I\'ll take care of it for you.
Tom taught French in Boston for three years.
Tom tells me you might want to stay with us.
I wanted Tom to buy Mary a birthday present.
I wanted to let you know you weren\'t alone.
Tom didn\'t pay any attention to my warning.
Tom didn\'t seem to understand what I meant.
Tom didn\'t think Mary would really do that.
I don\'t think we have enough paint thinner.
I don\'t think you understand the situation.
Let\'s discuss these problems one at a time.
Tom told me he doesn\'t know Mary very well.
Tom ran down the road as naked as a jaybird.
